title: UK weather: Two weeks of rainfall in just 12 hours with flooding and Met office warnings

Two weeks' worth of rain fell in just 12 hours last night as Britain was battered by heavy showers.

The Met Office has confirmed that 52.2mm - just over two inches - fell overnight in Islay, Scotland.

The average October rainfall is 3.6 inches across the entire month.

Yellow weather warnings are in place across much of England and Scotland, with forecasters saying flooding is possible.

Transport chaos could also follow, with rail cancellations and road closures possible.

(Image: PA)

The warnings are in place until midday.

The Met Office warned: "Spray and flooding could lead to difficult driving conditions and some road closures.

"Some communities may be cut off by flooded roads."

Met Office meteorologist Alex Burkill said Sunday's yellow warning was triggered by rain pushing eastwards across the UK.

(Image: Anita Maric / SWNS)

"It's going to stall and linger across northern and eastern parts of the UK tomorrow," he said.

The highest rainfall totals are expected in Scotland and northern England, but the highest rainfall rate is likely to be seen in Lincolnshire and East Anglia.

He explained: "That's where we could see quite a lot of rain in a few hours, whereas further north it will be longer but not as intense."

The warning covers much of Scotland, as well as northern, central and south eastern England.

WEATHER OUTLOOK

Sunday night

The evening will be mostly cloudy with patchy rain in central, eastern and south-east England although any rain will tend to peter out through the evening.

Later in the night it will become dry with clear spells for eastern parts of Scotland and England. Western areas will be cloudy, wet and windy

Monday

It will be mostly cloudy with rain in the morning, some of which will be heavy in the west. South-eastern areas will be mostly dry and cloudy but the odd spot of rain is possible.

Through the afternoon rain will sweep eastwards across the country, allowing bright spells to develop in the west.

Tuesday

Bright with a mix of sunny spells and showers, which will be heaviest and most frequent in the west. Strong south-westerly winds.

Wednesday

There will be further sunny spells and showers, but there will be more cloud and heavy showers in the north and west.

Brisk westerly winds.
description: The Met Office revealed that just over two inches of rain fell overnight in Islay, Scotland, with a yellow warning in place across much of the UK
